meanings.sent1: The little boy was tugging at his mother's hand to show her something exciting.
meanings.sent2: She was tugging the heavy suitcase up the stairs with all her might.
meanings.sent3: The kitten was tugging at the yarn, thinking it was a playful game.
meanings.sent4: His heart kept tugging him back to the memories of his childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The storm was tugging at the trees, making them sway dangerously.

meanings.definition: Struggling or exerting effort to move something
meanings.sent1: The team was tugging the giant rock, trying to get it out of the way.
meanings.sent2: She was tugging at the stuck drawer, hoping it would finally open.
meanings.sent3: The little duckling was tugging at the worm, determined to have it for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: Her mind kept tugging at the problem, searching for a solution.
meanings.sent5: The wind was tugging at the flag, making it flutter proudly in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Moving something by pulling it gently or repeatedly
meanings.sent1: She was tugging the zipper of her jacket to close it before going outside.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was tugging the weeds out of the flowerbeds to keep them tidy.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was tugging at the leash, eager to explore the park.
meanings.sent4: His words were tugging at her heart, bringing tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The musician's melody was tugging at the audience's emotions, creating a magical atmosphere.
